(Same as JS 348W 1)
(This course is an introductory survey of the prose and poetry of the Arab-Israeli conflict. The sessions will focus on analizing a selection of works related to the conflict, considering the role of literature in the construction of the two national identities and their claim of belonging to the same land which they cohabitate.)
course_description: This course will explore the literatures of identity and belonging in the context of the Arab-Israeli conflict. It will cover Modern Hebrew literature authored by Jewish-Israeli writers and literature produced by Arab Palestinians in Israel, the Occupied Territories and the Palestinian Diaspora.
